nodes.bodyText: These two are not needed for your usecase.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+#!/bin/sh
+
+root=saltboot
+rootok=1
+
+# If we don't have a server, we need dhcp
+if [ -z "$server" ] ; then
+    DHCPORSERVER="1"
+fi;
+
+export DISABLE_UNIQUE_SUFFIX=$(getarg DISABLE_UNIQUE_SUFFIX=)
+export kiwidebug=$(getarg kiwidebug=)

nodes.bodyText: I wonder if I need mgrbootstrap-root.sh at all?
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText: I think you don't need that at all. Just rename the preregister to mgrbootstrap.sh  so it is correctly installed as pre-mount hook.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@

nodes.bodyText: I need mgrbootstrap-root.sh at least to overwrite the empty root= .

nodes.bodyText: This is to print information to the plymouth theme, but you are not printing anything to /progress so this can be removed as well.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+if ! declare -f Echo > /dev/null ; then
+  Echo() {
+    echo "$@"
+  }
+fi
+
+if ! [ -s /etc/resolv.conf ] ; then
+    Echo "No network, skipping saltboot..."
+    exit 0
+fi
+
+IFCONFIG="$(compgen -G '/tmp/leaseinfo.*.dhcp.ipv*')"
+if [ -f "$IFCONFIG" ]; then
+    . "$IFCONFIG"
+else
+    Echo "No network details available, skipping saltboot";
+    exit 0
+fi
+
+NEWROOT=${NEWROOT:-/mnt}
+export NEWROOT
+
+if [ -e /usr/bin/plymouth ] ; then
+    mkfifo /progress
+    bash -c 'while true ; do read msg < /progress ; plymouth message --text="$msg" ; done ' &
+    PROGRESS_PID=$!
+else
+    mkfifo /progress
+    bash -c 'while true ; do read msg < /progress ; echo -n -e "\033[2K$msg\015" >/dev/console ; done ' &
+    PROGRESS_PID=$!
+fi

@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@

+
+if ! declare -f Echo > /dev/null ; then
+  Echo() {
+    echo "$@"
+  }
+fi
+
+if ! [ -s /etc/resolv.conf ] ; then
+    Echo "No network, skipping saltboot..."
+    exit 0

+

+if [ -f "$IFCONFIG" ]; then

+export NEWROOT
+
+if [ -e /usr/bin/plymouth ] ; then

+    bash -c 'while true ; do read msg < /progress ; plymouth message --text="$msg" ; done ' &
+    PROGRESS_PID=$!
+else

+    bash -c 'while true ; do read msg < /progress ; echo -n -e "\033[2K$msg\015" >/dev/console ; done ' &
+    PROGRESS_PID=$!
+fi

nodes.bodyText: This is for dig to be correctly called when interacting with MS DNS in saltboot. Not needed for your use case.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+if ! declare -f Echo > /dev/null ; then
+  Echo() {
+    echo "$@"
+  }
+fi
+
+if ! [ -s /etc/resolv.conf ] ; then
+    Echo "No network, skipping saltboot..."
+    exit 0
+fi
+
+IFCONFIG="$(compgen -G '/tmp/leaseinfo.*.dhcp.ipv*')"
+if [ -f "$IFCONFIG" ]; then
+    . "$IFCONFIG"
+else
+    Echo "No network details available, skipping saltboot";
+    exit 0
+fi
+
+NEWROOT=${NEWROOT:-/mnt}
+export NEWROOT
+
+if [ -e /usr/bin/plymouth ] ; then
+    mkfifo /progress
+    bash -c 'while true ; do read msg < /progress ; plymouth message --text="$msg" ; done ' &
+    PROGRESS_PID=$!
+else
+    mkfifo /progress
+    bash -c 'while true ; do read msg < /progress ; echo -n -e "\033[2K$msg\015" >/dev/console ; done ' &
+    PROGRESS_PID=$!
+fi
+
+rm /etc/machine-id
+mkdir -p /var/lib/dbus
+rm /var/lib/dbus/machine-id
+dbus-uuidgen --ensure
+systemd-machine-id-setup
+
+DIG_OPTIONS="+short"
+if dig -h | grep -q '\[no\]cookie'; then
+    DIG_OPTIONS="+nocookie +short"
+fi
+
+[ -n "$PROGRESS_PID" ] && kill $PROGRESS_PID

@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+if ! declare -f Echo > /dev/null ; then
+  Echo() {
+    echo "$@"
+  }
+fi
+
+if ! [ -s /etc/resolv.conf ] ; then
+    Echo "No network, skipping saltboot..."
+    exit 0
+fi
+
+IFCONFIG="$(compgen -G '/tmp/leaseinfo.*.dhcp.ipv*')"
+if [ -f "$IFCONFIG" ]; then
+    . "$IFCONFIG"
+else
+    Echo "No network details available, skipping saltboot";
+    exit 0
+fi
+
+NEWROOT=${NEWROOT:-/mnt}
+export NEWROOT
+
+if [ -e /usr/bin/plymouth ] ; then
+    mkfifo /progress
+    bash -c 'while true ; do read msg < /progress ; plymouth message --text="$msg" ; done ' &
+    PROGRESS_PID=$!
+else
+    mkfifo /progress
+    bash -c 'while true ; do read msg < /progress ; echo -n -e "\033[2K$msg\015" >/dev/console ; done ' &
+    PROGRESS_PID=$!
+fi
+
+rm /etc/machine-id
+mkdir -p /var/lib/dbus
+rm /var/lib/dbus/machine-id
+dbus-uuidgen --ensure
+systemd-machine-id-setup
+
+DIG_OPTIONS="+short"
+if dig -h | grep -q '\[no\]cookie'; then
+    DIG_OPTIONS="+nocookie +short"
+fi
+
+[ -n "$PROGRESS_PID" ] && kill $PROGRESS_PID

nodes.bodyText: Later you are calling ip directly, so you don't need this bits to source ip configuration.
